headerText: The `v-dialog` component inform users about a specific task and may contain critical information, require decisions, or involve multiple tasks. Use dialogs sparingly because they are interruptive.

usage.desc: A dialog contains two slots, one for its activator and one for its content (default). Good for Privacy Policies.

withoutActivator.desc: If for some reason you are unable to use the activator slot, be sure to add the `.stop` modifier to the event that triggers the dialog.

modal.desc: Similar to a Simple Dialog, except that it's not dismissed when touching outside.

fullscreen.desc: Due to limited space, full-screen dialogs may be more appropriate for mobile devices than dialogs used on devices with larger screens.

form.desc: Just a simple example of a form in a dialog.

scrollable.desc: Example of a dialog with scrollable content.

overflowed.desc: Modals that do not fit within the available window space will scroll the container.

advanced.desc: Choosing an option immediately closes the menu. Touching outside of the dialog, or pressing Back, cancels the action and closes the dialog.

loader.desc: The `v-dialog` component makes it easy to create a customized loading experience for your application.

props.disabled: Disables the ability to open the dialog
props.fullWidth: Specifies the modal to force 100% width
props.hideOverlay: Hides the display of the overlay
props.maxWidth: The maximum width of the content
props.noClickAnimation: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of a `v-dialog`'s content when using the **persistent** prop
props.persistent: Clicking outside will not dismiss the dialog
props.scrollable: When set to true, expects a card, card-title, card-text and card-actions. Additionally, card-text should have specified height. Will set card-text to overflow-y
